org.corfudb.client.abstractions

Class Stream

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.corfudb.client.abstractions.Stream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, IStream

    public class Stream
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable, IStream
    A hop-aware stream implementation. The stream must be closed after the application is done using it to free resources, or enclosed in a try-resource block.

      • Stream

        public Stream(CorfuDBClient cdbc,
              UUID uuid,
              int queueSize,
              int allocationSize,
              ExecutorService executor,
              boolean prefetch)
        Construct a new stream.
        Parameters:
        cdbc - The CorfuDB client to construct the stream with.
        uuid - The UUID of the stream to use.
        queueSize - The size of the internal stream queue.
        allocationSize - The allocation size to request from the sequencer, if supported.
        executor - The executor service thread pool to serve threads on.
        prefetch - Whether or not to prefetch data (up to the size of the internal queue)

    • Method Detail

      • append

        public Timestamp append(byte[] data)
                 throws OutOfSpaceException
        Append a byte array to the stream. This operation may or may not be successful. For example, a move operation may occur, and the append will not be part of the stream.
        Specified by:
        append in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        data - A byte array to append to the stream.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the physical position and the epoch the data was written in.
        Throws:
        OutOfSpaceException

      • append

        public Timestamp append(Serializable data)
                 throws OutOfSpaceException
        Append an object to the stream. This operation may or may not be successful. For example, a move operation may occur, and the append will not be part of the stream.
        Specified by:
        append in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        data - A serializable object to append to the stream.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the physical position and the epoch the data was written in.
        Throws:
        OutOfSpaceException

      • peek

        public CorfuDBStreamEntry peek()
        Peek at the next entry in the stream as a CorfuDBStreamEntry. This function peeks to see if there is an available entry in the stream to be read.
        Specified by:
        peek in interface IStream
        Returns:
        A CorfuDBStreamEntry containing the payload of the next entry in the stream, or null, if there is no entry available.

        When the stream is not prefetching, manually requests a dispatch, synchronously.

                                 throws IOException,
                                        InterruptedException
        Read the next entry in the stream as a CorfuDBStreamEntry. This function retireves the next entry in the stream, blocking if necessary.
        Specified by:
        readNextEntry in interface IStream
        Returns:
        A CorfuDBStreamEntry containing the payload of the next entry in the stream.
        Throws:
        IOException

                throws IOException,
                       InterruptedException

        public Object readNextObject()
                      throws IOException,
                             InterruptedException,
                             ClassNotFoundException
        Read the next entry in the stream as an Object. This convenience function retrieves the next entry in the stream, blocking if necessary.
        Specified by:
        readNextObject in interface IStream
        Returns:
        A deserialized object containing the payload of the next entry in the stream.
        Throws:
        IOException
        InterruptedException
        ClassNotFoundException

      • check

        public Timestamp check()
        Returns a fresh timestamp, which can serve as a linearization point. This function may return a non-linearizable (invalid) timestamp which may never occur in the ordering due to a move/epoch change.
        Specified by:
        check in interface IStream
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the most recently allocated timestamp in the stream.

      • check

        public Timestamp check(boolean cached)
        Returns a fresh or cached timestamp, which can serve as a linearization point. This function may return a non-linearizable (invalid) timestamp which may never occur in the ordering due to a move/epoch change.
        Specified by:
        check in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        cached - Whether or not the timestamp returned is cached.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the most recently allocated timestamp in the stream, or currently read, depending on whether cached is set or not.

      • check

        public Timestamp check(boolean cached,
                       boolean primary)
        Returns a fresh or cached timestamp, which can serve as a linearization point. This function may return a non-linearizable (invalid) timestamp which may never occur in the ordering due to a move/epoch change.
        Specified by:
        check in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        cached - Whether or not the timestamp returned is cached.
        primary - Whether or not to return timestamps only on the primary stream.
        Returns:
        A timestamp, which reflects the most recently allocated timestamp in the stream, or currently read, depending on whether cached is set or not.

      • trim

        public void trim(Timestamp address)
        Requests a trim on this stream. This function informs the configuration master that the position on this stream is trimmable, and moves the start position of this stream to the new position.
        Specified by:
        trim in interface IStream

      • sync

        public void sync(Timestamp pos)
          throws LinearizationException,
                 InterruptedException
        Synchronously block until we have seen the requested position.
        Specified by:
        sync in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        pos - The position to block until.
        Throws:
        LinearizationException
        InterruptedException

      • sync

        public boolean sync(Timestamp pos,
                    long timeout)
             throws LinearizationException,
                    InterruptedException
        Synchronously block until we have seen the requested position, or a certain amount of real time has elapsed.
        Specified by:
        sync in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        pos - The position to block until.
        timeout - The amount of time to wait. A negative number is interpreted as infinite.
        Returns:
        True, if the sync was successful, or false if the timeout was reached.
        Throws:
        LinearizationException
        InterruptedException

      • waitForEpochChange

        public void waitForEpochChange()
                        throws InterruptedException
        Synchronously block until an epoch change is seen. Useful for quickly detecting when a permanent move is successful.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • waitForEpochChange

        public boolean waitForEpochChange(long timeout)
                           throws InterruptedException
        Synchronously block until an epoch change is seen, or a certain amount of real time has elapsed. Useful for quickly detecting when a permanent move is successful.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The amount of time to wait. A negative number is interpreted as infinite.
        Returns:
        True, if an epoch change occurs, or false if the timeout was reached.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • waitForEpochChange

        public void waitForEpochChange(Timestamp t)
                        throws InterruptedException
        Synchronously block until an epoch change is seen compared to a given timestamp. Useful for quickly detecting when a permanent move is successful.
        Parameters:
        t - The timestamp to compare against.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • waitForEpochChange

        public boolean waitForEpochChange(Timestamp t,
                                  long timeout)
                           throws InterruptedException
        Synchronously block until an epoch change is seen compared to a given timestmap, or a certain amount of real time has elapsed. Useful for quickly detecting when a permanent move is successful.
        Parameters:
        t - The timestamp to compare against.
        timeout - The amount of time to wait. A negative number is interpreted as infinite.
        Returns:
        True, if an epoch change occurs, or false if the timeout was reached.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • hopLog

        public void hopLog(UUID destinationLog)
            throws RemoteException,
                   OutOfSpaceException,
                   IOException
        Permanently hop to another log. This function tries to hop this stream to another log by obtaining a position in the destination log and inserting a move entry from the source log to the destination log. It may or may not be successful.
        Specified by:
        hopLog in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        destinationlog - The destination log to hop to.
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        OutOfSpaceException
        IOException

      • pullStream

        public Timestamp pullStream(UUID targetStream)
                     throws RemoteException,
                            OutOfSpaceException,
                            IOException
        Permanently pull a remote stream into this stream. This function tries to attach a remote stream to this stream. It may or may not succeed.
        Specified by:
        pullStream in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        targetStream - The destination stream to attach.
        Returns:
        A timestamp indicating where the attachment begins.
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        OutOfSpaceException
        IOException

      • pullStream

        public Timestamp pullStream(UUID targetStream,
                            int duration)
                     throws RemoteException,
                            OutOfSpaceException,
                            IOException
        Temporarily pull a remote stream into this stream. This function tries to attach a remote stream to this stream. It may or may not succeed.
        Specified by:
        pullStream in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        targetStream - The destination stream to attach.
        duration - The length of time, in log entries that this pull should last, if -1, then the pull is permanent.
        Returns:
        A timestamp indicating where the attachment begins.
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        OutOfSpaceException
        IOException

                            Serializable payload,
                            int duration)
                     throws RemoteException,
                            OutOfSpaceException,
                            IOException

        targetStreams - The destination streams to attach.
        payload - The serializable payload to insert
        duration - The length of time, in log entries that this pull should last, if -1, then the pull is permanent.

        Throws:

        OutOfSpaceException

      • pullStream

        public Timestamp pullStream(List<UUID> targetStreams,
                            Serializable payload,
                            int reservation,
                            int duration)
                     throws RemoteException,
                            OutOfSpaceException,
                            IOException
        Temporarily pull multiple remote streams into this stream, including a serializable payload in the remote move operation, and optionally reserve extra entries. This function tries to attach multiple remote stream to this stream. It may or may not succeed.
        Specified by:
        pullStream in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        targetStreams - The destination streams to attach.
        payload - The serializable payload to insert
        reservation - The number of entires to reserve, both in the local and global log.
        duration - The length of time, in log entries that this pull should last, if -1, then the pull is permanent.
        Returns:
        A timestamp indicating where the attachment begins.
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        OutOfSpaceException
        IOException

      • pullStream

        public Timestamp pullStream(List<UUID> targetStreams,
                            byte[] payload,
                            int reservation,
                            int duration)
                     throws RemoteException,
                            OutOfSpaceException,
                            IOException
        Temporarily pull multiple remote streams into this stream, including a payload in the remote move operation, and optionally reserve extra entries. This function tries to attach multiple remote stream to this stream. It may or may not succeed.
        Specified by:
        pullStream in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        targetStreams - The destination streams to attach.
        payload - The payload to insert
        reservation - The number of entries to reserve, both in the local and the remote log.
        duration - The length of time, in log entries that this pull should last, if -1, then the pull is permanent.
        Returns:
        A timestamp indicating where the attachment begins.
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        OutOfSpaceException
        IOException

                                    byte[] payload,

                             throws RemoteException,
                                    OutOfSpaceException,
                                    IOException
        Description copied from interface: IStream
        Temporarily pull multiple remote streams into this stream, including a payload in the remote move operation, and optionally reserve extra entries, using a BundleEntry. This function tries to attach multiple remote stream to this stream. It may or may not succeed.
        Specified by:
        pullStreamAsBundle in interface IStream
        Parameters:
        targetStreams - The destination streams to attach.
        payload - The payload to insert
        slots - The length of time, in slots that this pull should last.

        A timestamp indicating where the attachment begins.
